bibl.title: Letter from Leatha Logan to Philip Showalter Hench, January 31, 1946

div1.p: Lazear writes that she is preparing a booklet on the yellow fever experiments. She was given a copy of “Conquerors of Yellow Fever” and saw a photograph of Building No. 1 in it. She requests permission to use the photograph in her booklet.

div1.head: Letter from Leatha Logan to Philip Showalter Hench, January 31, 1946
div1.opener:
Marion-Indiana.
Jan-31-1946
Mr. Phillip Hench- M,D,-
Rochester- Minn-
Dear Sir-
div1.p:
I had the pleasure
this summer of reading your article
in the W. & J. “Milepost” relative to
Dr. Lazear and yellow fever and only
today was handed by a Marion
physician a copy “Conquerors of yellow
fever” which had come to him from
J. Wyeth & Bro. Phila- in company with
a painting of those most closely connected
with the yellow fever Conquest,

I am preparing a booklet which
will be just a brief biography and
history of those persons - Drs - Reed - Lazear -
Carroll - Finlay - Gorgas & Carter & Messrs.
Kissinger and Moran - closest to the conquest.

Reading through ‘Conquerors of Yellow
Fever I came to the picture of
“Building No. 1”’ and saw at once
the interest it would add to my
other book material should I be
able to secure a picture large
enough to show the individuals
in the picture well.

I imagine you took the picture and
thought you might have a film
that I could borrow or perhaps you
have another picture you would
sell. I should be only too happy
to pay for one.

Any way you can or care to accommo-
date me will be more than appreciated,

Thanking you for any service you
can give I am-
div1.closer:
Very Truly Miss Leatha Lazaer
Marion.
Indiana #1505 - West Nelson St.
P. S. The last knowledge I had of it
researchers had not isolated the germ they were
seeking. Have they done so by now if you
don't mind saying? Thanks
L. L,
